channel.title: 634 Help Thread. Help with [Compiler, Char files and commands]
channel.description:
I just downloaded the dimenthium 634 client and was playing around with it until it cames to char files....which were all in .bin format and when opened with notepad, lets say it didn't make any sense.
Does anyone know how to edit .bin files?

item.title: 634 Help Thread. Help with [Compiler, Char files and commands]
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“ipwnunoobs, post:43, topic:394022”]Found it. here is my new command thanks to your help
turns out abs was completely wrong >.> and so was the + rofl

if (command[0].equals("pos")) {
			ActionSender.sendMessage(player, player.getLocation().toString());
		}

[EDIT] let me change the title :)[/quote]

Yeah that’s the way I have it in my server. I wasn’t sure if your server used the same type of thing, since most of them use absX or posX, etc.

Read full topic

item.title: 634 Help Thread. Help with [Compiler, Char files and commands]
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“ipwnunoobs, post:39, topic:394022”][code]

  • World.getWorld().getPlayers().size() +
    [/code]

the “+”[/quote]

Because you’re adding something to something else.

(“a” + b + “c”) is valid
(“a” + b +) is invalid because the last + isn’t adding anything. It’s expecting something to be on both sides, but if there isn’t, then it throws an error.

Read full topic

item.title: 634 Help Thread. Help with [Compiler, Char files and commands]
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“ipwnunoobs, post:35, topic:394022”]
Fixed Compiler By Sn0wFox
src\org\dementhium\content\Commands.java:119: illegal start of expression
player.sendMessage(+ absX + “,” + absY +);
^
1 error
Press any key to continue . . .[/quote]

As I said before, you’re trying to add something to nothing. (The first and last + signs.)

item.title: 634 Help Thread. Help with [Compiler, Char files and commands]
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“ipwnunoobs, post:33, topic:394022”]Ok, I rooted out one major problem where “Actionsender” was supposed to be “Player”.

But, when i compile and save, and do ::mypos

I get faced with a normal "X: +absX+ Y: +absY+’

No coords just that, which my mean that “abs(V)” where V is the variable isn’t the actual variable for position

absX and Xpos work only for PI and Delta?

Any ideas?

So where would I find the variable for 634?[/quote]

No, you must have the variable name outside quotes.

"X: " + absX + ", Y: " + absY

Note how the variables (absX/Y) aren’t inside the quotes.

Read full topic
item.source: 634 Help Thread. Help with [Compiler, Char files and commands]

I get faced with a normal "X: +absX+ Y: +absY+’

No coords just that, which my mean that “abs(V)” where V is the variable isn’t the actual variable for position

absX and Xpos work only for PI and Delta?

Any ideas?

So where would I find the variable for 634?

Read full topic

item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“ipwnunoobs, post:31, topic:394022”]thanks you got rid of 7 erros

but your code is wrong where

comands.java:91 illegal start of expression
Actionsender.sendMessage(+ absX+ “,” + absY+);[/quote]

That’s because you’re trying to add something to nothing (the first + sign).

Read full topic

item.source: 634 Help Thread. Help with [Compiler, Char files and commands]

item.title: 634 Help Thread. Help with [Compiler, Char files and commands]
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“ipwnunoobs, post:29, topic:394022”]which is currently
if (command[0].startsWith(“mypos”)) {
ActionSender.sendMessage("+absX+"; “+absY”);
}

only to be face with illegal start of expression, “)” and “;” expected errors which i do not think should be there o.O or am i wrong?[/quote]

The reason for that is because you’ve formed the String incorrectly. The “+absX+” is taken literally, because it’s in quotation. Variables can’t be in quotations. What it should look like is

sendMessage(a + ", " + b);

Note that you are concatenating, or adding the variables a and b to string ", ".

So if a and be were “1” and “false” respectively, it would say
“1, false”

Read full topic

item.title: 634 Help Thread. Help with [Compiler, Char files and commands]
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“ipwnunoobs, post:25, topic:394022”]So there’s no way? o.O
Other than designing the program.[/quote]

You could either:
Go into each character file manually, find the correct byte offset, add some values and save
Give the item to each player on login (Duping imminent)
Give the item to each player on login, with a variable saying if they’ve received it or not.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“ipwnunoobs, post:23, topic:394022”]ILY SO MUCH <3…Though the level thing did not work, so i have to go inside the compile.bat and change the class file path/name and save then compile… but anyways Ily

Now this leaves us with the problem of… .bin files :s, this is also concerning as my drops file is also a .bin…

I’m off for 30 mins gotta do assignment.[/quote]

The only thing I can think of is making a simple program that deserializes the data into a player object, adding the item to their inventory, and then saving their account. Otherwise you’d have to go through each file manually and edit it.

item.title: 634 Help Thread. Help with [Compiler, Char files and commands]
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“ipwnunoobs, post:21, topic:394022”]I just got so confused right there, anyhow

Do i replace the * with the class names? or leave it like that, which means that each //.java is a folder and a class inside it.

[EDIT] I think i’m stupid or something… Got it…Testing[/quote]

Yes, * means any. So /.java means for example

a/a.java
b/q.java
z/i.java

etc.

Read full topic
